content: #socks_net by @floralwool easy to knit cuff down socks yarn & needles choose any sock yarn 400-420m in 100gr 4 ply and needles suitable for your desired gauge and sock size 2 0-2 5mm cuff cast on a number of stitches that is a multiple of 8 join to knit in the round being careful not to twist the stitches work 10 14 rounds in k1 p1 ribbing leg continue working according to the pattern chart repeating the 8-stitch pattern across the round repeat the pattern repeat 5 8 times or until you reach your desired leg length heel work the heel of your choice e g slip_stitch heel flap short row heel etc after completing the heel you will continue to work in the round the sole stitches are worked in plain stockinette knit all sts the instep stitches continue in pattern as follows instep after heel to make the pattern symmetrical add 1 stitch before the first pattern repeat for the upper part of the sock this stitch is marked on the chart and helps center the pattern continue knitting according to the chart on the instep and plain stockinette on the sole work as many pattern repeats as needed to reach the beginning of the toes the point where your smallest toe starts toe work the toe shaping of your choice e g classic wedge toe rounded toe etc until 8 12 stitches remain graft the remaining stitches together using kitchener stitch or close as you prefer finishing weave in all ends block gently to open up the pattern and even out the stitches
